speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: SCENE III. A heath near Forres.

speaker: DUNCAN
text_entry: Thunder. Enter the three Witches

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: Where hast thou been, sister?

speaker: Second Witch
text_entry: Killing swine.

speaker: Third Witch
text_entry: Sister, where thou?

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: A sailor's wife had chestnuts in her lap,

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: And munch'd, and munch'd, and munch'd:--

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: 'Give me,' quoth I:

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: 'Aroint thee, witch!' the rump-fed ronyon cries.

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: Her husband's to Aleppo gone, master o' the Tiger:

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: But in a sieve I'll thither sail,

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: And, like a rat without a tail,

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: I'll do, I'll do, and I'll do.

speaker: Second Witch
text_entry: I'll give thee a wind.

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: Thou'rt kind.

speaker: Third Witch
text_entry: And I another.

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: I myself have all the other,

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: And the very ports they blow,

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: All the quarters that they know

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: I' the shipman's card.

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: I will drain him dry as hay:

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: Sleep shall neither night nor day

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: Hang upon his pent-house lid;

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: He shall live a man forbid:

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: Weary se'nnights nine times nine

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: Shall he dwindle, peak and pine:

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: Though his bark cannot be lost,

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: Yet it shall be tempest-tost.

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: Look what I have.

speaker: Second Witch
text_entry: Show me, show me.

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: Here I have a pilot's thumb,

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: Wreck'd as homeward he did come.

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: Drum within

speaker: Third Witch
text_entry: A drum, a drum!

speaker: Third Witch
text_entry: Macbeth doth come.

speaker: ALL
text_entry: The weird sisters, hand in hand,

speaker: ALL
text_entry: Posters of the sea and land,

speaker: ALL
text_entry: Thus do go about, about:

speaker: ALL
text_entry: Thrice to thine and thrice to mine

speaker: ALL
text_entry: And thrice again, to make up nine.

speaker: ALL
text_entry: Peace! the charm's wound up.

speaker: ALL
text_entry: Enter MACBETH and BANQUO

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: So foul and fair a day I have not seen.

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: How far is't call'd to Forres? What are these

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: So wither'd and so wild in their attire,

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: That look not like the inhabitants o' the earth,

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: And yet are on't? Live you? or are you aught

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: That man may question? You seem to understand me,

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: By each at once her chappy finger laying

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: Upon her skinny lips: you should be women,

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: And yet your beards forbid me to interpret

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: That you are so.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Speak, if you can: what are you?

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: All hail, Macbeth! hail to thee, thane of Glamis!

speaker: Second Witch
text_entry: All hail, Macbeth, hail to thee, thane of Cawdor!

speaker: Third Witch
text_entry: All hail, Macbeth, thou shalt be king hereafter!

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: Good sir, why do you start; and seem to fear

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: Things that do sound so fair? I' the name of truth,

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: Are ye fantastical, or that indeed

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: Which outwardly ye show? My noble partner

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: You greet with present grace and great prediction

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: Of noble having and of royal hope,

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: That he seems rapt withal: to me you speak not.

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: If you can look into the seeds of time,

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: And say which grain will grow and which will not,

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: Speak then to me, who neither beg nor fear

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: Your favours nor your hate.

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: Hail!

speaker: Second Witch
text_entry: Hail!

speaker: Third Witch
text_entry: Hail!

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: Lesser than Macbeth, and greater.

speaker: Second Witch
text_entry: Not so happy, yet much happier.

speaker: Third Witch
text_entry: Thou shalt get kings, though thou be none:

speaker: Third Witch
text_entry: So all hail, Macbeth and Banquo!

speaker: First Witch
text_entry: Banquo and Macbeth, all hail!

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Stay, you imperfect speakers, tell me more:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: By Sinel's death I know I am thane of Glamis;

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: But how of Cawdor? the thane of Cawdor lives,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: A prosperous gentleman; and to be king

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Stands not within the prospect of belief,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: No more than to be Cawdor. Say from whence

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: You owe this strange intelligence? or why

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Upon this blasted heath you stop our way

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: With such prophetic greeting? Speak, I charge you.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Witches vanish

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: The earth hath bubbles, as the water has,

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: And these are of them. Whither are they vanish'd?

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Into the air; and what seem'd corporal melted

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: As breath into the wind. Would they had stay'd!

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: Were such things here as we do speak about?

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: Or have we eaten on the insane root

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: That takes the reason prisoner?

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Your children shall be kings.

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: You shall be king.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And thane of Cawdor too: went it not so?

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: To the selfsame tune and words. Who's here?

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: Enter ROSS and ANGUS

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: The king hath happily received, Macbeth,

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: The news of thy success; and when he reads

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Thy personal venture in the rebels' fight,

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: His wonders and his praises do contend

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Which should be thine or his: silenced with that,

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: In viewing o'er the rest o' the selfsame day,

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: He finds thee in the stout Norweyan ranks,

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Nothing afeard of what thyself didst make,

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Strange images of death. As thick as hail

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Came post with post; and every one did bear

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: Thy praises in his kingdom's great defence,

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: And pour'd them down before him.

speaker: ANGUS
text_entry: We are sent

speaker: ANGUS
text_entry: To give thee from our royal master thanks;

speaker: ANGUS
text_entry: Only to herald thee into his sight,

speaker: ANGUS
text_entry: Not pay thee.

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: And, for an earnest of a greater honour,

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: He bade me, from him, call thee thane of Cawdor:

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: In which addition, hail, most worthy thane!

speaker: ROSS
text_entry: For it is thine.

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: What, can the devil speak true?

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: The thane of Cawdor lives: why do you dress me

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: In borrow'd robes?

speaker: ANGUS
text_entry: Who was the thane lives yet;

speaker: ANGUS
text_entry: But under heavy judgment bears that life

speaker: ANGUS
text_entry: Which he deserves to lose. Whether he was combined

speaker: ANGUS
text_entry: With those of Norway, or did line the rebel

speaker: ANGUS
text_entry: With hidden help and vantage, or that with both

speaker: ANGUS
text_entry: He labour'd in his country's wreck, I know not;

speaker: ANGUS
text_entry: But treasons capital, confess'd and proved,

speaker: ANGUS
text_entry: Have overthrown him.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: [Aside]  Glamis, and thane of Cawdor!

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: The greatest is behind.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: To ROSS and ANGUS

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Thanks for your pains.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: To BANQUO

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Do you not hope your children shall be kings,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: When those that gave the thane of Cawdor to me

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Promised no less to them?

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: That trusted home

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: Might yet enkindle you unto the crown,

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: Besides the thane of Cawdor. But 'tis strange:

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: And oftentimes, to win us to our harm,

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: The instruments of darkness tell us truths,

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: Win us with honest trifles, to betray's

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: In deepest consequence.

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: Cousins, a word, I pray you.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: [Aside] Two truths are told,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: As happy prologues to the swelling act

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Of the imperial theme.--I thank you, gentlemen.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Aside

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Cannot be ill, cannot be good: if ill,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Why hath it given me earnest of success,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Commencing in a truth? I am thane of Cawdor:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: If good, why do I yield to that suggestion

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Whose horrid image doth unfix my hair

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: And make my seated heart knock at my ribs,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Against the use of nature? Present fears

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Are less than horrible imaginings:

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: My thought, whose murder yet is but fantastical,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Shakes so my single state of man that function

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Is smother'd in surmise, and nothing is

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: But what is not.

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: Look, how our partner's rapt.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: [Aside]  If chance will have me king, why, chance may crown me,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Without my stir.

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: New horrors come upon him,

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: Like our strange garments, cleave not to their mould

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: But with the aid of use.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: [Aside]                Come what come may,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Time and the hour runs through the roughest day.

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: Worthy Macbeth, we stay upon your leisure.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Give me your favour: my dull brain was wrought

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: With things forgotten. Kind gentlemen, your pains

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Are register'd where every day I turn

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: The leaf to read them. Let us toward the king.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Think upon what hath chanced, and, at more time,

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: The interim having weigh'd it, let us speak

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Our free hearts each to other.

speaker: BANQUO
text_entry: Very gladly.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Till then, enough. Come, friends.

speaker: MACBETH
text_entry: Exeunt
